title: Revert Operation Slower than Close and Reopen in Java Editor
description: The revert operation in the Java editor is significantly slower than the close and reopen operations.
OB:
When opening an editor for the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' within the open-source repository:
1) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty.
2) On a fast machine, it takes about 8 seconds to perform the following steps:
   a) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
   b) Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
   c) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
SR: Repeat steps 1 and 2, then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. The revert operation takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
